009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
014
015/**
016 * This class represents a line in slope-intercept form: y = k x + d.
017 * Instances are immutable. Not all possible lines in the 2D plane
018 * can be represented.
019 * A {@link SlopeInterceptLine} is merely a {@link AlgebraicLine}
020 * with a special constructor and getter methods for k, d.
021 */
022public class SlopeInterceptLine extends AlgebraicLine {
023        
024        public SlopeInterceptLine(double k, double d) {
025                super(k, -1, d);
026        }
027        
028        public SlopeInterceptLine(AlgebraicLine al) {
029                super(al.getParameters());
030                if (Arithmetic.isZero(al.B)) {
031                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert vertical line (B=0)");
032                }
033        }
034        
035        public double getK() {
036                return A / -B;  // = k
037        }
038
039        public double getD() {
040                return C / -B;  // = d
041        }
042        
043        /**
044         * Returns the line's y-value for the specified x-position.
045         * @param x position along the x-axis
046         * @return the associated y-value
047         */
048        public double getY(double x) {
049                return (A * x + C) / -B;        // = y = k * x + d
050        }
051        
052        // --------------------------------------------------
053        
054        @Override
055        public String toString() {
056                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <A=%.3f B=%.3f C=%.3f k=%.3f, d=%.3f>",
057                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), A, B, C, getK(), getD());
058        }
059        
060        // --------------------------------------------------
061        
062//      public static void main (String[] args) {
063//              Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, 2);
064//              Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(4, 3);
065//              
066//              AlgebraicLine al1 = AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2);
067//              System.out.println("al1 = " + al1);
068//              
069//              SlopeInterceptLine sl = new SlopeInterceptLine(al1);
070//              System.out.println("sl = " + sl);
071//              System.out.println("sl k = " + (sl.A / -sl.B));
072//              System.out.println("sl d = " + (sl.C / -sl.B));
073//              
074//              AlgebraicLine al2 = AlgebraicLine.from(sl);
075//              System.out.println("al2 = " + al2);
076//              
077//              System.out.println("al1 = al2 ? " + al1.equals(al2, 1e-6));
078//      }
079/*
080al1 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
081sl = SlopeInterceptLine <A=0.316 B=-0.949 C=1.581 k=0.333, d=1.667>
082sl k = 0.33333333333333337
083sl d = 1.6666666666666665
084al2 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
085al1 = al2 ? true
086*/
087}
